metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5313 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the virStorageBackendFileSystemVolCreate function in storage/storage_backend_fs.c in libvirt, when fine-grained Access Control Lists (ACL) are in effect, allows local users with storage_vol:create ACL but not domain:write permission to write to arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in a volume name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirt-bin - 1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.16
libvirt0 - 1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.16').
